1.text: And the third day was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

2.text: And Jesus was also called, and his disciples, to the wedding.

3.text: And wine having failed, the mother of Jesus says to him, They have no wine.

4.text: And Jesus says to her, What to me and thee, woman mine hour comes not yet.

5.text: His mother says to the servants, Whatever he says to you, do.

6.text: And six stone water buckets were placed there, according to the purification of the Jews, containing each two or three measures.

7.text: Jesus says to them, Fill the water buckets with water. And they filled them even up over.

8.text: And he says to them, Draw now, and carry to the superintendent of the feast. And they carried.

9.text: And when the superintendent of the feast tasted the wine having been water, and knew not whence it is: (and the servants knew, having drawn the water;) the superintendent calls the bridegroom,

10.text: And says to him, Every man sets good wine first; and when they be intoxicated, then inferior: thou hast kept the good wine till now.

11.text: This beginning of signs did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

12.text: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they remained there not many days.

13.text: And the pascha of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

14.text: And found in the temple those selling oxen and sheep and doves, and money-changers sitting;

15.text: And having made a scourge of ropes, he cast all out of the temple, also sheep, and oxen; and poured out the small coin of money-changers, and overturned the tables;

16.text: And he said to those selling doves, Take away these things hence; make not the house of my Father a house of merchandise.

17.text: And his disciples remembered that it is written, The zeal of thine house has eaten me up.

18.text: Then answered the Jews and said to him, What sign shewest thou, that thou doest these things?

19.text: Jesus answered and said to them, Loose this temple, and in three days will I raise it up.

20.text: Then said the Jews, In forty-six years was this temple built, and wilt thou raise it up in three days?

21.text: But he spake concerning the temple of his body.

22.text: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this to them; and they believed the writing, and the word which Jesus spake.

23.text: And when he was in Jerusalem at the pascha, in the festival, many believed in his name, beholding his signs which he did.

24.text: And Jesus himself trusted not himself to them, for he knew all,

25.text: For also he had no need that any should testify concerning man: for he knew what was in man.
